userInterface
Class GameFrame

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          java.awt.Window
              java.awt.Frame
                  javax.swing.JFrame
                      userInterface.GameFrame
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
public class GameFrame
extends javax.swing.JFrame

This class acts as the game window. It can't be resized by the user by mouse clicking and dragging, it should be resized from the GameClient display configuration options (if they are enabled). It uses to listen window events since it has a WindowListener. Whenever the GameFrame listens for a WindowEvent, it passes the event to the GameEngine for processing it.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Method Detail

addGameEngine

public void addGameEngine(GameEngine gameEngine)
Parameters:
gameEngine - - The GameEngine instance This method append the engine GameEngine instance to the GameFrame

setGameFrameDimension

public void setGameFrameDimension(java.awt.Dimension newDimension)
Parameters:
newDimension - The requested Dimension wich the GameFrame should try to change to. This method assign the gameFrameDimension field to the newDimension Dimension instance, and it sets the GameFrame dimension if, and only if, the Java Full Screen Exclusive Mode is turned off.

getGameFrameDimension

public java.awt.Dimension getGameFrameDimension()
This method gets the current GameEngine Dimension.

Returns:
gameFrameDimension - The current dimension of the GameEngine

showGameFrame

public void showGameFrame()
This method makes the GameFrame not resizable and it attempts to made it visible. If the Java Full Screen Exclusive Mode is turned on, it calls the setFullScreenOn() method. Furthermore, it packs the GameFrame to its GameEngine and finally makes it visible.

See Also:
setFullScreenON()

setFullScreenDisplayMode

public void setFullScreenDisplayMode(java.awt.DisplayMode newDisplayMode)
Parameters:
newDisplayMode - The requested DisplayMode wich the GameFrame should try to change to. This method is used to change the DisplayMode when the GameFrame is running in FSEM. It first checks if the newDisplayMode is in the avaibleDisplayModes, and if it is, it attempts to change it. If a RuntimeException occurs during the process, there will be an attempt to recover the old DisplayMode. If that's not possible GameFrame will exit from running in FSEM.

getDisplayMode

public java.awt.DisplayMode getDisplayMode()
This method gets the current DisplayMode for the GameEngine instace.

Returns:
currentDisplayMode - the current DisplayMode

instantiate

public static GameFrame instantiate()
This method is used to get a GameFrame instance following the Single-Town model

Returns:
a GameFrame instance
